Miscellaneous Highlights: The regular season finale between the Guardians and Houston Astros was cancelled due to rain, preventing Cleveland third baseman José Ramírez from a shot at hitting his 40th home run and joining the exclusive 40-40 club.
Cleveland's jump in the standings after winning 76 games in 2023 led to a bump in attendance as the Guardians drew more than 2 million fans at home for the first time since 2017.
Others: Astros: LF Yordan Alvarez (knee sprain) was scheduled to do more baseball activities in Houston, and as long as he continues to make progress, it's likely he'll be on the wild card roster.

Guardians: RHP Alex Cobb (middle finger blister) had his usual velocity during a 35-pitch simulated game. He'll throw another on Thursday and Vogt said the team is moving forward with plans to have him pitch in the postseason.
